ovdesc.p: This file contains records which are used by the Management Information module to reallocate profit and loss. When the allocation process is run, records on the CATEG.ENTRY file are read and MI.AUTO.ENTRY records are produced.
The allocation process may be run during the end of day processing or on line. The on line processing is triggered via the MI.BUILD.DATABASE file.

This field indicates whether MI.AUTO.ENTRY records should be netted when they are created. If this flag is set to VALUE then entries which have the same :
Will be netted together if the account officer from which the entries were created are the same, e.g. takes into account the value date and booking date of the incoming records.

When this flag is set to MONTHLY the value.date is set to the end of the month it had value in and the booking date will be set to the system date on which the allocation was run. This option provides for a higher level of netting and will result in fewer records.
Only Input of VALUE, MONTHLY or NONE will be excepted.
Optional Input. If left blank then the entry will not be netted.

Profit and loss from the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER specified in the key of the record and matching the related category range is allocated to the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER specified in this field.
Field three (DEPT.TO) to field six (CATEG.FROM) form a related sub value set.
Field one (CATEGORY.START) to seven (NETTED) form a related multi value set.
Must be a valid record on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER file.
1 to 4 Numeric characters. Mandatory Input.

This field holds the category code which will be on the MI.AUTO.ENTRY record generated for the department / account officer specified in the key of this record as the balancing entry to one created for the department account officer specified in the DEPT.TO field.
If this field is left blank then the CATEGORY of the incoming entry will be used as a default at run time.
Field three (DEPT.TO) to field six (CATEG.FROM) form a related sub value set.
Field one (CATEGORY.START) to seven (NETTED) form a related multi value set.
1 to 6 Numeric characters.
Must be a valid record on the CATEGORY file.

If this field is left blank then the CATEGORY of the incoming entry will be used as a default at run time.
Field three (DEPT.TO) to field six (CATEG.FROM) form a related sub value set.

This field, in conjunction with the field CATEGORY.START, is used to define a range of categories for which profit and loss will be re allocated from the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER specified in the key of the record to those specified in the field DEPT.TO.
If this field is left blank, the value in the CATEGORY.START field will need to be match exactly for the related values to be used.
Field one (CATEGORY.START) to seven (NETTED) form a related multi value set.
Must be a valid record on the category file.
1 to 5 Numeric characters. Optional input.

If the field CATEGORY.END is left blank, the value in this field will need to be match exactly for the related values to be used.
